Probabilistic classification: toy example

{% raw %} 
np.random.seed(42)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
X, y = sklearn.datasets.make_classification(n_samples=5000, n_features=5, n_informative=3, n_classes=3)
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = sklearn.model_selection.train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.2, shuffle=True)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
logreg = sklearn.svm.SVC(probability=True)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
logreg.fit(X_train, y_train)

SVC(probability=True)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
y_probs = logreg.predict_proba(X_test)
y_preds = y_probs.argmax(axis=1)

print(f"Accuracy: {sklearn.metrics.accuracy_score(y_test, y_preds)}")
print(f"Balanced accuracy: {sklearn.metrics.balanced_accuracy_score(y_test, y_preds)}")

Accuracy: 0.868
Balanced accuracy: 0.8682246668791995
{% endraw %}

Metric definition

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

peace[source]

peace(y_probs, y_preds, y_true, samples=1000, bins='fd')

Compute the posterior expected balanced accuracy-based calibration error (PEACE).

Parameters: y_probs (np.array): predicted class probabilities y_preds (np.array): predicted class labels y_true (np.array): true class labels samples (int): number of samples for numerical integration

Returns: exp_ce (float): expected calibration error

{% endraw %}

Provide the metric with the probabilities associated with the prediction, the prediction itself, and the true labels.

{% raw %} 
peace(y_probs.max(axis=1), y_preds, y_test, bins="count")

0.06382770335914473
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
peace(y_probs.max(axis=1), y_preds, y_test, bins="fd")

0.05893617924357199
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
peace(y_probs.max(axis=1), y_preds, y_test, bins=15)

0.03765348930383863
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

ece[source]

ece(y_probs, y_preds, y_true, balanced=False, bins='fd')

Compute the expected calibration error (ECE).

Parameters: y_probs (np.array): predicted class probabilities y_preds (np.array): predicted class labels y_true (np.array): true class labels

Returns: exp_ce (float): expected calibration error

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
ece(y_probs.max(axis=1), y_preds, y_test, bins="count")

0.03747143584963988
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

ece_v2[source]

ece_v2(y_probs, y_preds, y_true, bins='fd')

Compute the expected calibration error based on the expected posterior balanced accuracy (ECEv2).

Parameters: y_probs (np.array): predicted class probabilities y_preds (np.array): predicted class labels y_true (np.array): true class labels

Returns: exp_ce (float): expected calibration error

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
ece_v2(y_probs.max(axis=1), y_preds, y_test)

0.04830056103874785
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class_wise_error[source]

class_wise_error(y_probs, y_preds, y_true, base_error, *base_error_args, **base_error_kwargs)

Compute classwise-error as proposed in "Beyond temperature scaling: Obtaining well-calibrated multiclass probabilities with Dirichlet calibration" (Kull, 2019).

Parameters: y_probs (np.array): predicted class probabilities y_preds (np.array): predicted class labels y_true (np.array): true class labels base_error (callable): function that returns ECE for given probabilities, label predictions and true labels baseerror[kw]args ([kw]args): [Keyword ]arguments that should be passed to the base_ece callable.

Returns: exp_ce (float): class-wise expected calibration error

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
class_wise_error(y_probs, y_preds, y_test, base_error=peace, bins=15)

0.05637736547369911
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
class_wise_error(y_probs, y_preds, y_test, base_error=peace, bins="count")

0.06013517463348155
{% endraw %}
